properties.name: Extension: Object slicer
properties.description:
Test the Object Slicer extension, which can slice an object into smaller pieces that match the color of original object.  

Useful for creating death animations such as explosions, crumbling, dissolve, or teleportation effects.
Pieces should be a solid white color or the color of the piece not match the original color.

Tips:
- Pieces are linked to the original object which can be used in other events (i.e. explode away from the original object)

origin.identifier: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Abstract Platformer Pack (370 assets)/PNG/Tiles/tiled_Wall for Blue Floor.png
origin.name: gdevelop-asset-store

objects.name: Instructions
objects.string: Click on an object to crumble it

events.name: Click on a single object to crumble
After a few seconds, delete pieces and show the original object

events.comment: Set variables based on slider values
Update text with current values
Update text
Show the color that the mouse is on

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: We don't use the touch capability condition because the device could have both touch and cursor.
The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

Ignore mouse events when a touch is active because the mouse is probably an echo of touch events.
The mouse press could be a touch that has not the right TouchId.
The trigger once must be before the state condition to detect a new press.

Ignore mouse events when a touch is active because the mouse is probably an echo of touch events.
The mouse release could be a touch release that has not the right TouchId.

eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

events.comment: Using a function avoid the OR to unselect Object when the property is not set.

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/), D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Checkbox
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Checkbox that can be toggled by a left-click or touch.
description: Users can click on the checkbox to add and remove the checkmark.
How to use:
- Add this extension to a shape painter object
- Use condition "Is checked" to find out the state of the checkbox
Tips:
- Checkbox state can also be changed by an action.
- Checkbox can be disabled so that users cannot interact with it
- To remove halo, Set "halo hover" and "halo pressed" opacity to 0

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SineMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.
description: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.
Example uses:
- Floating objects, such as powerups or coins
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
Properties:
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Vertical speed
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position
Tips:
- For circular or elliptical movement, the horizontal and vertical speed need to be the same
- For horizontal movement only, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement only, set horizontal distance to 0
- For figure-8 movement, set horizontal speed to 1/2 of the vertical speed

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave.

Example uses:
- Floating pickups
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement

Properties:
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Horizontal distance

Tips:
- For circular or elliptical movement, the horizontal and vertical speed need to be the same
- For horizontal movement, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement, set horizontal distance to 0
- For figure-8 movement, set horizontal speed to 1/2 of the vertical speed

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/), D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggableSliderControl
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
description: Draws a draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
The value range, tick spacing, and the appearance of the slider can be defined with properties.
How to use:
- Add this behavior a **Shape Painter** object
- Place an instance of that shape painter on the screen where you want the slider to appear
- Use the "Value" expression to find the Value based on the position of the slider
Tips:
- You can disable the slider to prevent a user from interacting with it
- You can set the Value of the slider and the slider will move to the correct position
Further details can be found in [this tutorial video](https://youtu.be/iiTUwdAT_hs).
Breaking changes (1.0.0)
- Track thickness and length properties replaced track width and height. These 2 properties must be set again if they were different from the default size.
- Hidden sliders can be dragged. The "enable" action must be used to disable them.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let users select a numerical value by dragging a slider.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ExplosionForce
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Simulate an explosion with physics forces on target objects
description: Apply explosion-like physics forces to target objects that are inside the explosion radius.  Forces push the target objects away from the explosion center.  The force applied is stronger the closer the target object is to the explosion center.  Target objects will be changed to "Dynamic" physics objects.
Requirements:
- Target Objects must have physics behavior
- The action "Pick all instances" of Target Objects MUST be used directly above this action.
Object Variables (Target Objects):
- "__ExplosionForce.Exploded" (boolean)
- "__ExplosionForce.Magnitude" (number)
Tips:
- Start objects as "Static" physics objects so they won't move or fall over until the explosion automatically converts them to "Dynamic".
- Use the "__ExplosionForce.Exploded" object variable to manage objects that were affected by an explosion.  (For instance, start an opacity tween that fades away and deletes the objects.)
- If your game freezes during an explosion, try using smaller radius or max force values.

eventsFunctions.description: Simulate an explosion with physics forces on target objects
eventsFunctions.name: ApplyExplosionForce
eventsFunctions.sentence: Simulate an explosion that affects _PARAM1_ within explosion radius: _PARAM6_ (pixels), Explosion center: _PARAM3_, _PARAM4_.  Max force: _PARAM5_

events.comment: Make sure object is dynamic
Set an object variable that can be used to manage objects affected by the explosion (such as opacity tween and delete)
Calculate explosion force based on how close it is to the center of explosion
Apply explosion forces away from the center (power based on distance from center)

parameters.longDescription: Force decreases the farther an object is from the explosion center.
parameters.name: MaxForce

parameters.longDescription: Objects less than this distance will be affected by the explosion.
parameters.name: ExplosionRadius

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (tristan@victrisgames.com)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Create multiple copies of an object
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CreateMultipleCopiesOfObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Select the object, choose the number of rows and columns, the spacing between rows and columns, the top left starting point, the layer to create the objects on, and the z-order of the objects.
description: This extension can be used to create multiple copies of an object in a wide variety of arrangements, including:
- horizontal row(s)
- vertical column(s)
- a solid rectangle or square
- an evenly spaced grid
- a grid with different spacing between rows and columns
After the objects are created, you can reference their object variables to manage the objects:
* `RowID`:  what horizontal row does this object reside in,
* `ColumnID`:  what vertical column does this object reside in,
* `CreationID`:  starting top-left, and proceeding from left to right, what is the number of the created object,
* `BatchID`:  optional identifier assigned to all objects created
Watch this [tutorial video](https://youtu.be/rlGSlNSRR9w) to see examples of how to use this extension.

eventsFunctions.description:
Create multiple copies of an object.
Select the object, choose the number of rows and columns, the spacing between rows and columns, the top left starting point, the layer to create the objects on, and the z-order of the objects.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Create multiple copies of an object
eventsFunctions.name: CreateMultipleCopiesOfObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create _PARAM2_ rows and _PARAM3_ columns of _PARAM1_ objects, with top-left starting position _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_, with _PARAM6_px between rows and _PARAM7_px between columns. Create objects on _PARAM9_ with a Z-value of _PARAM10_. Assign all objects the BatchID of _PARAM8_.

events.comment: Temp object is created to record its width and height (which is needed to calculate spacing).
Temp variables to track progress in drawing the grid
Starting at top left, create objects in grid.
If the current row is complete, move to the next row.
If the last row is complete, stop creating new objects.

parameters.description: (Optional) Identifier assigned to all objects created in this batch
parameters.name: BatchID

eventsFunctions.description: Check if something is true
eventsFunctions.name: IF

eventsFunctions.description: ELSE
eventsFunctions.name: ELSE_IF

eventsFunctions.description: END IF
eventsFunctions.name: END_IF

eventsFunctions.description: Init Game Statistics
eventsFunctions.name: init

eventsFunctions.description: Show or Hide Game Statistics
eventsFunctions.name: showPanel

eventsFunctions.description: Create panel
eventsFunctions.name: addPanel

eventsFunctions.description: Create divider
eventsFunctions.name: addDivider

eventsFunctions.description: Console log
eventsFunctions.name: ConsoleLog

eventsFunctions.description: rigger command on console
eventsFunctions.name: triggerCommand

inlineCode: let has = gdjs._vstats.app.hasCommand(cmd, log) ? true : false

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ReadPixels
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Read the values of pixels on the screen.
description: This extension allow to read pixels on screen.
| Expression | Argument  | Type returned |
|  ReadPixelRed(x, y)  | position x: number, position y: number | number (0-255) |
|  ReadPixelGreen(x, y)  | position x: number, position  y: number | number (0-255) |
|  ReadPixelBlue(x, y)  | position x: number, position y: number | number (0-255) |
|  ReadPixelAlpha(x, y)  | position x: number, position y: number | number (0-255) |

eventsFunctions.description: Return the alpha component of the pixel at the specified position.
eventsFunctions.name: ReadPixelAlpha

inlineCode: // 3 is for alpha in pixel buffer

eventsFunctions.description: Return the blue component of the pixel at the specified position.
eventsFunctions.name: ReadPixelBlue

inlineCode: // 2 is for blue in pixel buffer

eventsFunctions.description: Return the green component of the pixel at the specified position.
eventsFunctions.name: ReadPixelGreen

inlineCode: // 1 is for green in pixel buffer

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ObjectSlicer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Slice an object into smaller pieces that match the color of original object.
description: Useful for creating death animations such as explosions, crumbling, dissolve, or teleportation effects.
Pieces should be a solid white color or the color of the piece will not match the original color.
Tips:
- Adjust the collision mask to control where pieces will be created
- Pieces are linked to the original object which can be used in other events (i.e. explode away from the original object)

eventsFunctions.description: Slice an object into smaller pieces that match color of the original object. The new object should be a solid white color.
eventsFunctions.name: SliceObjectIntoPieces
eventsFunctions.sentence: Cut _PARAM1_ into _PARAM3_ vertical strips and _PARAM4_ horizontal strips using _PARAM2_ for the new objects. Delete original object: _PARAM5_

events.comment: Calculate dimensions of small objects
Record the top left corner of sprite
Scan sprite from top to bottom
Search left to right
Record the center of Fragment (used to check if it would be inside the collision mask)
Only create objects when their center would be inside the collison mask of the object
Adjust the size of the new object
Set position based on center of piece (in case the origin has been moved)
Match the color of the pixel that is in the center of the new Fragment
Search to the right
Search down and start over on the left side
Delete object if desired

parameters.longDescription: Recommended: Use a sprite that is a single white pixel
